title: RS21868
content: On March 15, 2004, the United States and the Dominican Republic concluded a draftfree-trade agreement tointegrate the Dominican Republic into the earlier signed Central American Free-Trade Agreement (CAFTA). Thefinal agreement (DR-CAFTA) was signed byall parties on August 5, 2004. The Dominican Republic would have its own market access provisions, but wouldaccept the rest of the CAFTA framework. Legislation to implement DR-CAFTA might be considered in the 109th Congress. This report willbe updated as developments occur.
